page.title: 18E.C.C. QUARRIES LIMITED
page.content:
by Richard Walter, Special Unit.
This company makes concrete blocks from gravel, sand and dust. The sand comes from Dorset, the stone from the Mendips. A machine called a shovel puts the things on a long conveyor belt. They are dropped down onto another long belt which takes them up to the mixing machine. This looks like a gigantic food mixer. When it is mixed it drops down into a huge bucket and is then transferred to the moulds. This was almost all auto- matically controlled. They are left to dry for about three days. They are turned over by a special machine. It can turn thirty-six blocks at once. They make 20,000 blocks every day. The men work fast because they get paid for how many blocks they make.
